HOME SCHOOL SUPPORT

During the current Covid-19 outbreak situation we will be adding links to useful learning opportunities and resources here. These will be in sections relating to classes, subject leaders or additional need pupils and each section will be in order of publication with the most recent content at the top of each section.

Another great, free learning resource below:

Free Homework & Revision for A Level, GCSE, KS3 & KS2

Pick from 1000+ KS2, KS3, GCSE & A Level courses based on exam board specifications. We’ve condensed the content to what you actually need to know for your exams. Your teacher can also create classes and set homework for any revision topic on the study platform creating the perfect lesson plan.

Reading Books Online- reading remains the key to learning and these websites help you to find reading materials at the correct phonics level or comprehension level for your child:

Reading support during COVID-19:

Reading Support May 2020

Board

Instructions

Parents may like to use this reading rewards at home

t2-e-5011-author-reading-challenge-activity-sheet-

Have some fun

Looking for something fun as a family? Enjoy storytime with our free online books and videos, play games, win prizes, test your knowledge in our book-themed quizzes, or even learn how to draw some of your favourite characters. Please note: We sometimes link to third party sites, including YouTube, so children should not use HomeTime unsupervised.

(for younger readers)

Tumble Book Library (for Y2-Y6)

You can log in by going to:
www.tumblebooklibrary.com
Username: readingisfab
Password: trial (free until 31st July)

BBC BITESIZE- DAILY LESSONS FOR ALL AGES ON TV AND ONLINE

Home – BBC Bitesize

Use BBC Bitesize to help with your homework, revision and learning. Find free videos, step-by-step guides, activities and quizzes by level and subject.

OAK NATIONAL ACADEMY

Home – Oak National Academy

Visit our online classroom and access our free lessons. Here you can search for lessons by subject and year group, or follow our suggested weekly schedule. In our dedicated Teacher Hub you can browse our full curriculum, search and view our lessons, and download, edit and share slides, worksheets and videos with your pupils and colleagues.

Resources, schemes of work and videos to support parents- developed by some of the leading teachers and school leaders across the UK!

Online activities – Leeds Museums and Galleries

We also use different external services like Google Webfonts, Google Maps, and external Video providers. Since these providers may collect personal data like your IP address we allow you to block them here. Please be aware that this might heavily reduce the functionality and appearance of our site.

Learning | Royal Armouries

We know that this autumn term you have your work cut out under the most challenging of circumstances. Learning outside the classroom may well be the last thing on your mind. For that reason, until December, we have modified our outstanding schools programme. A COVID-secure visit to the Royal Armouries is available if you want it.

Freedom to explore maths:

Mathematical Freedom Archives – YouCubed

Students at youcubed summer camp, whose test scores improved by an average of 50% after just 18 days of mindset math, progress equivalent to 2.8 years of school, gave many reasons for their changed achievement: the power of seeing math visually, of knowing that mistakes and struggle are good for brain growth and feeling really liberated by that.

RealPE free programme:

real PE at home – online learning resources

real PE at home includes an online programme which supports families to be active, play and learn together. It includes a programme specifically for children in Early Years and Key Stage 1 with 12 themes, 6 areas, over 250 activities and challenges and 1000s of hours of fun and activity.

For children in Key Stage 2 there are carefully selected personal best challenges, skills and games designed for the home and garden. Daily and weekly guidance is provided for both programmes in addition to an option to choose your own themes and activities.

There are so many benefits to being active, not only to our physical wellbeing but also to our emotional and mental health, especially in such testing times for all of us. We hope that the ideas help support you and your family to stay fit and healthy in the coming months. Here are the details to access real PE at home:

The website address is: home.jasmineactive.com 
Parent email: parent@springvale-1.com

Password: springvale

 

Click here to view more information to support you including a user guide and FAQs.

 

Excellent Online Safety guidance packs:

Online safety home activity worksheets

Over the last few months many schools across the UK closed to most families. This page has been created to provide you with the support and resources to help learn about online safety at home with your child. Our online safety at home campaign continues with a focus on activities you can do as a whole family.

Maths Chase – Times Tables Games – Fun Maths Tests

Maths Chase provides free maths games to help students learn. Test your times tables, addition and other maths skills in a fun and engaging way.

Helping children with worries or anxiety about Coronavirus:

Depression, anxiety and mental health

If your child has been feeling unhappy or anxious for a long time, or is showing signs of self-harm or suicidal thoughts, it’s important to consider professional help so that they can get the support they need. Child and adolescent mental health services (CAMHS) is a free NHS service for children and young people under 18.

White Rose Scheme Work (matches school scheme exactly)

Home Learning | White Rose Maths

Now that schools are reopening, children will be reunited with their friends and teachers at last. Of course, we’re still some distance from ‘business as usual’ in schools, but White Rose Maths will very happily carry on helping you support your child to enjoy and master maths both in school and at home.

 

Free COLLINS support:

We have secured an amazing free online resources through Collins and one of our amazing families! F2-Y2 will have access to super scheme books that will support phonics and early reading and we have also now got access to maths games from EYFS to Y6!

Details below:

They can all now login to access the Maths games/tools and the Big Cat eBooks by going to https://connect.collins.co.uk/school/SPRINGVA2/Student/ and entering the details provided on email. (We cannot publish these online but we can share them on email.)

 

Please remember that the key things are lots and lots of recap and revision on the basics. Multiplication games, sounds, quizzes. Spelling lists. NUMBOTS and TT Rockstars. Keep a journal. Read a book 10-20 minutes and discuss what has been read, what might happen next, the vocabulary choices of the author, etc.

Twinkl Access for all families is free: https://www.twinkl.co.uk/

Password: uktwinklcares or CVDtwinklhelps

Home school timetable

Home play sensory and learning ideas

Children with Speech and Language Needs:

LCH CSLT Toolkit

Our screening assessment tool uses pictures and tasks to help identify children who may have speech, language or communication difficulties. By completing the screen, you will know if the child would benefit from some extra support or whether they would meet the criteria for a referral to the Children’s Speech and Language Therapy Service (CSLT).

 

Phonics Play is free and brilliant! 25 minutes daily is ideal!

PhonicsPlay

A site packed with interactive phonics games, phonics planning, assessment ideas and many teaching ideas and resources to help children to learn to hear phonemes, recognise graphemes and develop the blending and segmenting skills that are vital for learning to read and spell.

 

EYFS and Y1 (as above plus the TEACH YOUR MONSTER TO READ WEBSITE)

Teach Your Monster to Read

The game has been funded by the Usborne Foundation, a charity set up to support initiatives to develop early literacy. Our mission is to help as many children learn to read as possible. The computer version is 100% free and we put profits from the app back into the Usborne Foundation, to continue to create new and exciting ways for children to learn.

Y5 things to do:

1) practise for general knowledge quiz

2)choose an idea from the homework sheet on ‘Greece’

3) practise spellings and use a dictionary to write the words definition , then write their own sentence to use the spelling word appropriately

4) practise joining handwriting- especially letters y, g , a , d, r, n, f and e

5) TT rockstars- ready for the pyramid school competition

6)if they have an empty shoe box, decorate it as a ‘memory box’. Can cut out magazines, adverts, comics, draw pictures to stick on etc! Get creative

7) keep a diary- especially to record their emotions

8) write a letter to their grandparents

9)https://www.birminghammuseums.org.uk/schools/bmag-for-kids

Ancient Greek section and design a Greek pot

10) research notes for their chosen non-chronological report on their Ancient Greek theme ( I have a list if they’ve forgotten what they’ve chosen)!

11) play maths games https://mathszone.co.uk/

Especially ones on fractions, decimals and percentages.

Fun suggestions from parents:

12 Famous Museums With Virtual Tours For While You’re Stuck At Home

Going into a self-quarantine can have many complex issues and complications beyond having enough food and supplies for two weeks. In terms of entertainment, it also probably means you’re in for a lot of boredom, a lot of Netflix, and a lot of browsing the internet.

The Creation Station are attempting a creative Guinness World Record between now and October based on a collaged portrait – prizes to be won too…

 

https://www.thecreationstation.co.uk/inspiration/exciting-guinness-world-record-attempt-to-do-at-home-for-all-ages-lets-be-officially-amazing-
